main event: A radar incident involving unidentified high-speed tracks observed from Montauk, New York to Benson, Pennsylvania on September 20, 1957.
interesting points: Two radar units were tracking high-speed objects; however, nothing unusual could be observed visually., The initial track on radar was established at a surprising speed of 3600 knots., The Montauk AFS and Benton AFS had simultaneous radar activity correlating to these tracks., Investigations suggested possible radar equipment malfunction and split radar beams causing confusion in tracking., There was no visual confirmation of unidentified objects despite radar alerts and F-102 aircraft being scrambled.
witness description: no visual witnesses as the sighting was primarily based on radar tracking
